thread.title: State agency investigates how autistic worker never got paid - Rhode Island news
thread.title_full: State agency investigates how autistic worker never got paid - Rhode Island news

author: boston.com
title: State agency investigates how autistic worker never got paid - Rhode Island news
text:
CRANSTON, R.I. (AP) — The Rhode Island Department of Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities and Hospitals is investigating how an autistic man went unpaid after working hundreds of hours at a local Applebee’s restaurant.
The parents of 21-year-old Caleb Dyl tells WPRI-TV (http://bit.ly/1kwxtAQ ) that their son was hired by the Applebee’s in Middletown in August 2014 after working without being paid for a year during training.
 Caleb was placed in the job by Pawtucket-based nonprofit Resources for Human Development.
Applebee’s officials say the Middletown restaurant was unaware of the issue until receiving a call from WPRI.
The Dyls say they complained to management numerous times.
Applebee’s officials say Caleb will be mailed a check for 166 hours worked at the minimum wage rate of $9 an hour, but the Dyls estimate Caleb worked double that amount.
___
Information from: WPRI-TV, http://www.wpri.com
